    • checkPositionsAccessbility

      public java.util.List<int[]> checkPositionsAccessbility​(java.util.List<int[]> positions)
      Checks accessibility of positions on the map. If any of position's coordinates is smaller than 0, it is ignored and added to returned list for further handle. The same happens when any of these coordinates is greater than map boundary.
      Specified by:
      checkPositionsAccessbility in interface IMap
      Parameters:
      positions - List of positions to check.
      Returns:
      List representing accessible positions on the map.

    • isPositionAccessible

      Verifies whether given position is accessible for moving to.
      Specified by:
      isPositionAccessible in interface IMap
      Parameters:
      position - Position to check.
      Returns:
      Boolean value representing whether position is accessible.

    • isPositionWithinMap

      public boolean isPositionWithinMap​(int[] position)
      Checks if position is within the map.
      Specified by:
      isPositionWithinMap in interface IMap
      Parameters:
      position - Position to check.
      Returns:
      True if position is within the map; false if beyond.

    • isPositionWithinMap

      public boolean isPositionWithinMap​(int x, int y)
      Checks if position is within the map.
      Specified by:
      isPositionWithinMap in interface IMap
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of checked position.
      y - Y coordinate of checked position.
      Returns:
      True if position is within the map; false if beyond.
